definition: to receive/to accept/to collect/to put away/to restrain/to stop/in care of (used on address line after name)

sentences.english: Payment is valid only after the cheque is cleared.
sentences.chinese: 支票付款須待支票收訖後才生效。

sentences.english: The accountant's job is to enter all the money receive in the account.
sentences.chinese: 會計工作是將全部收訖的錢入帳。

sentences.english: The invoice has the stamp ' received with thanks ' on it.
sentences.chinese: 收據上蓋有“已收訖，謝謝”字樣的章。

sentences.english: We trust you have duly received the goods and find them to your satisfaction.
sentences.chinese: 我們相信貨物定已按時收訖，並能令貴方滿意。
他在發票上蓋上了“收訖”字樣。

sentences.english: The accountant 's job is to enter all the money received in the account.
sentences.chinese: 會計工作是將全部收訖的錢入帳。

sentences.english: The invoice have the stamp "received with thanks" on it.
sentences.chinese: 收據上蓋有“已收訖，謝謝”字樣的章。
出納員在賬單上蓋上“收訖”印記。
